item.title: Markets are plunging worldwide after ‘Big Short’ investor Michael Burry reveals $1.1 billion bet against AI stocks
item.description: Wall Street expects tech stocks to take a hammering this morning—again.

item.title: Former FBI special agent says he used a simple trick to get the best hotel rooms in the world—and it’s all about showing love to the front desk
item.description: According to licensed private investigator Tom Simon, "I've been doing this for 20 years and the rooms I get are majestic, man."

item.title: Ulta Beauty CEO Kecia Steelman went from earning $8 an hour to running the U.S.’s largest beauty retailer
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Corcoran Group CEO says Gen Z and millionaires alike are flocking back to the city—but return-to-office mandates aren’t the main reason
item.description: CEO of one of the nation’s largest realtors says New York’s gravitational pull is back—but it’s career insurance, not RTO, driving people to return.

item.title: Meet OpenAI’s master builder: Greg Brockman is steering a $1.4 trillion infrastructure surge with stakes that go far beyond AI
item.description: As OpenAI's president, Brockman is steamrolling toward "completing the mission" of moving beyond AI to artificial general intelligence (AGI).
